In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Certainly! Here is a sample implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input)
    current_line_length = 0
    output = ""

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            output *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end
        
        output *= " $word"
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1
    end

    return output
end
```

Here's an example showing how to use the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width=20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This code will wrap the input text by adding a new line whenever the maximum text width of 20 characters is exceeded. Feel free to adjust the `text_width` parameter as needed.
